article:
A 'faux pas' ( plural: faux pas ) is a socially awkward or tactless act,
especially one that violates accepted social norms, standard customs, or
the rules of etiquette. [http://www.ldoceonline.com/dictionary/faux-pas
faux pas â Definition from Longman English Dictionary Online ]

The expression comes from French, where it means "false step", "misstep" (in a
physical as well as a figurative sense). [http://www.merriam-
webster.com/dictionary/faux+pas Faux pas â Definition and More from the Merriam-
Webster Dictionary ] Having been used in English
for over 300 years, [http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/faux+pas faux
pas in Dictionary.com] it is no longer italicized in writing. Synonyms
include gaffe and (social) blunder.
